description:
FilOz advanced the **Filecoin core protocol** through design, coordination, and delivery of major upgrades.  
The team led specification and integration work for [FIP-0100](https://github.com/filecoin-project/FIPs/blob/master/FIPS/fip-0100.md), [FIP-0105](https://github.com/filecoin-project/FIPs/blob/master/FIPS/fip-0105.md), [FIP-0106](https://github.com/filecoin-project/FIPs/blob/master/FIPS/fip-0106.md), and [FIP-0109](https://github.com/filecoin-project/FIPs/blob/master/FIPS/fip-0109.md), alongside coordinated rollouts of NV25–NV27.  

These efforts introduced **F3 finality**, improved protocol efficiency, and ensured consistent cross-client behavior through Implementers WG collaboration.  

The result was a stable, forward-compatible protocol layer that supports predictable execution and provides a stronger foundation for emerging Filecoin on-chain services.
additional_impact:
FilOz’s protocol work goes beyond engineering.  

The team facilitates cross-client collaboration through the Implementers Working Group, ensures open governance of protocol changes via the FIP process, and maintains transparent communication across the ecosystem during upgrade cycles.  

These efforts have strengthened trust in the Filecoin upgrade process and improved the network’s ability to evolve safely while maintaining decentralized coordination among implementation teams.
end_user:
The primary beneficiaries are Filecoin client teams, Storage/Service Providers, researchers, and builders who rely on predictable protocol behaviour and reliable upgrades.  

FilOz’s work on F3, FIPs, and network version rollouts ensures that every participant in the Filecoin network can operate within a stable and well-coordinated protocol environment.  

By maintaining alignment across multiple client implementations and enabling smooth upgrade execution, FilOz supports both day-to-day node operations and long-term ecosystem growth.
testimonials:
FilOz’s protocol development work has received consistent positive feedback from developers and ecosystem contributors across the Filecoin network.  

Community discussions, Implementers Working Group meetings, and FIP review threads regularly highlight the team’s responsiveness, clear communication, and coordination during major network upgrades.  

This recognition reflects the confidence and trust FilOz has built among engineers, node operators, and researchers who depend on predictable and well-managed protocol evolution.  

Further context and references can be found on the FilOz Medium page: [https://medium.com/@filoz](https://medium.com/@filoz)
number_of_projects_dependent_on_fil_prot:
Every application, client, and on-chain service in the Filecoin ecosystem depends on the core protocol mechanisms developed and maintained by FilOz.  

This includes all consensus logic, actor code, and FVM interfaces implemented through [FIP-0100](https://github.com/filecoin-project/FIPs/blob/master/FIPS/fip-0100.md), [FIP-0105](https://github.com/filecoin-project/FIPs/blob/master/FIPS/fip-0105.md), [FIP-0106](https://github.com/filecoin-project/FIPs/blob/master/FIPS/fip-0106.md), and [FIP-0109](https://github.com/filecoin-project/FIPs/blob/master/FIPS/fip-0109.md).

Because these mechanisms underpin the entire Filecoin protocol, **100% of projects and network participants** operate on this foundation - including Filecoin clients, storage and service providers, and ecosystem applications that rely on protocol-level behavior for execution, verification, and on-chain interaction.
usability_or_infrastructure_impact:
FilOz’s protocol research and coordination work directly improved the usability and reliability of Filecoin’s core infrastructure.  
Through the design and deployment of [FIP-0100](https://github.com/filecoin-project/FIPs/blob/master/FIPS/fip-0100.md), [FIP-0105](https://github.com/filecoin-project/FIPs/blob/master/FIPS/fip-0105.md), [FIP-0106](https://github.com/filecoin-project/FIPs/blob/master/FIPS/fip-0106.md), and [FIP-0109](https://github.com/filecoin-project/FIPs/blob/master/FIPS/fip-0109.md), FilOz introduced **F3 finality** and optimized gas accounting, consensus timing, and actor logic across all client implementations.

These changes reduced block-propagation latency, improved RPC response times, and stabilized chain sync and execution behaviour across Lotus, Venus, Forest, and Curio.  

As a result, Filecoin users and builders experience faster confirmations, more predictable transaction execution, and more reliable infrastructure performance across Mainnet and test networks.
efficiency_increase_impact:
FilOz’s protocol work improved the efficiency of storage operations across the Filecoin network by reducing gas usage, computation load, and sealing overhead at the protocol layer.  
Through [FIP-0100](https://github.com/filecoin-project/FIPs/blob/master/FIPS/fip-0100.md), [FIP-0105](https://github.com/filecoin-project/FIPs/blob/master/FIPS/fip-0105.md), [FIP-0106](https://github.com/filecoin-project/FIPs/blob/master/FIPS/fip-0106.md), and [FIP-0109](https://github.com/filecoin-project/FIPs/blob/master/FIPS/fip-0109.md), FilOz introduced optimizations that improved gas accounting, actor execution, and message throughput across all clients.

These changes decreased sealing-related transaction costs, lowered resource requirements for node operation, and improved overall chain throughput.  

Together, these updates made Filecoin’s on-chain storage and verification processes faster, leaner, and more predictable for both Storage Providers and ecosystem services.
performance_impact:
FilOz’s work on [FIP-0100](https://github.com/filecoin-project/FIPs/blob/master/FIPS/fip-0100.md), [FIP-0105](https://github.com/filecoin-project/FIPs/blob/master/FIPS/fip-0105.md), [FIP-0106](https://github.com/filecoin-project/FIPs/blob/master/FIPS/fip-0106.md), and [FIP-0109](https://github.com/filecoin-project/FIPs/blob/master/FIPS/fip-0109.md) delivered measurable improvements in Filecoin’s overall performance and reliability.  

The introduction of **F3 finality** reduced block confirmation times, improved chain synchronization, and strengthened network stability during upgrades (NV25–NV27).  

Optimizations to actor execution and gas accounting increased throughput and reduced processing latency for on-chain operations.  

Across the NV25–NV27 cycle, these combined improvements led to faster message propagation, more predictable transaction inclusion, and smoother upgrade transitions — resulting in a more efficient and performant Filecoin mainnet.
